Black colored, medium tan creamy head, nice lacing, OK lasting. Aroma is malty, coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate, very inviting. Taste is medium sweet malt, roasted malt and dark chocolate, some toffee, coffee, vanilla, medium roasty bitterness, dry finish. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, creamy-silky. Excellent!
(bottle, Hollywood, Karlovac)

330 ml bottle into pint glass, best before 10/28/2017. Pours crystal clear nearly opaque dark brown color with a 2 finger dense and rocky light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, brown sugar, toasted dark bread, herbal, floral, and grass; with lighter notes of vanilla, molasses, licorice, dark fruit, smoke, char, nuttiness, pepper, yeast/roast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of roast/bready malt and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, brown sugar, toasted dark bread, herbal, floral, and grass; with lighter notes of vanilla, molasses, licorice, dark fruit, smoke, char, nuttiness, pepper, yeast/roast/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate roast/char and herbal/spicy hop bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, brown sugar, toasted dark bread, nuttiness, herbal, floral, grass, light pepper, smoke, char, and yeast/roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop flavors; with an awesome roast/hop bitter/sweet balance; and zero acrid/astringent roast/hop flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from roast/hop bitterness, increasing through the glass. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/silky/bready, and fairly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 6%. Overall this is an incredible dry stout! All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to drink with the modestly bitter/drying finish. Very rich and complex roasted barley flavors; with complementing/balancing earthy hops and yeast in the background. A highly enjoyable offering, and best Ive had in the style!
Mørk brun med lys beige skum. Lukter av sjokolade og vanilje. Medium fylde og noe krydret i smak. Sjokolade kommer i avslutningen.
Bottle: Nice stout with coffee, dark chocolate, malts, nut. Flavor follows this.

La Oharas Leann Follain est une bière Stout brassée par la brasserie Carlow Brewing Company en Irlande. Elle se présente sous une robe noire opaque dotée dune tête crémeuse beige assez tenace et propose en dégustation des arômes de malts de chocolat rôti, de réglisse, de malts torréfiés avec une note de café légèrement sucré, et un soupçon léger de vanille. Elle reste une bière moyennement corsée dans une texture crémeuse et à la carbonation moyenne. Une bière irlandaise stout corsée et savoureuse qui mérite toute votre curiosité !

Drunk in Shamrock Dresden,
Black beer with cappuccino head, smell is mocha, flat carbonation, taste is very mild, thin body, you feel not the alcohol, mocha, dark chocolate, very good,
(I have 0.33l bottle)

Fortes notes de café, grillé, assez peu sur le chocolat (un peu plus au nez). Bonne stout, agréable en fin de repas.

Flasche 0,5l: Schwarz, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger brauner Schaum; kräftige würzige Nase, leichte dunkle Süße, Röstmalz, Malzzucker, kräftige Röstaromen, dunkle eingelegte Früchte, leicht nussig, trockene Bitterkeit, dunkle Schokolade; sehr würziger kräftiger Körper, dunkle bittere Süße, kräftige Röstaromen, Röstmalz, Malzzucker, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, sehr trocken, leichte Eichenaromen, etwas Rauch; angenehmer trocken-würziger Nachgang mit kräftigen Röstaromen

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, lactose maybe, slight vanilla, roasty. Appearance is dark brown, light brown head, poured thin. Taste is roasty, chocolate, smoke, vanilla, cream, nutty, good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, dry nutty roasty aftertaste. Overall, solid.
St Patricks day @ So bière. Stout agréable qui présente une amertume comparable à celle de la Guiness mais avec plus de malt torréfié.

Appearance: clear ruby brown with one finger of beige head, good retention and no lacing. (3/5) Aroma: dry cacao and coffee roasty malt, vanilla, hint of nut, light ash. (7/10) Taste: moderate-low sweet, moderate bitter. (7/10) Palate: medium-full body, moderate-low carbonation, dry mildly bitter finish. (4/5)

7/10 #ryansbooze ryansbooze.com

AKA OHaras Extra Irish Stout. 330 ml bottle
Pours very dark brown, essentially black but with mahogany edges in the light. Large, creamy beige head. Impressive. 
Aroma (after the head dies down): Appealing. Bready and nutty
Rich malty flavor with plenty of dark roasted grain flavor and just a touch of smoke. Medium bitterness. Medium+ body with a dry finish. 

Overall: clearly above average for style.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, ashy, smoky.
Appearance: jetblack and creamy head.
Taste: low herbal bitterness, roasted dark malts, smoky, ashy, burnt malt, caramel, smooth and dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Really nice FES, really roasted and smoky.
Black beer, dimishing light brown head. Malty, light chocolate aroma. Malt, light chocolate, a touch of coffee and a little bitter hop. Nice, dry, almost smoky finish. Rich, creamy mouthfeel. Lovely.

330ml . A low boost  stout that came in a differing box of craft beers ...Im seldom motivated to ratebeer , but this was a gift .   Roasted malt nose giving birth to coffee nuance , burnt toast , cole , licorice , caramel syrup. Good fucken looking beer .. creamy and dark ..just like i like my women . Nice dry roasted , burnt , bitter sweet palate , every nuance offered on this nose resides in the flavour. Punchy little stout . enjoyable

Chocolade bruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, chocolade, mout. Smaakt smaakt moutig, vanille, chocolade.
Guinness achtige stout met vanille. Wel iets minder dan de enige echte, en ruik nog steeds weinig.

Black, tan head.Lightly roasted sweet nose and palate with light but lasting bitterness in the finish
Black, hardly any head. Aroma of toffee, chocolate, toast, dark bread crust, prunes. Medium bitter-sweet, a little on the sweet side. Full body, oily texture, medium to light carbonation. Quite nice!

Bottle. Black pour with a rich tan head. Aroma is chocolate, roasty with a little vanilla. Taste is lighter than expected for the ABV, but nice, chocolate and vanilla, subtle roastiness, pretty balanced, light dry finish.

Bottle: 330 ml,Price: 1,69 eur

Kräftig rosty, viel dunkle Heftigkeit und natürlich säuerlich schlank. Da bleibt einiges zurück, nachdem das erste Schlückchen die Kehle passiert hat. Elegant könnte man sagen. 0,33/4,90, Bottle, HOPFENLIEBE Norderstedt.

Bottle, picked up in Ireland at Ellens wedding. Looks like a stout, dark brown black with reddish depths, creamy off white head. Quite big and boozy at 6%, sweetish, malts are roasty but smooth and not overly bitter. Bit of butter. Whole thing was sweeter, and less dry/bitter than perhaps expected. But still tasty.

I am a big fan of stout beer especially when it has a craft element to it. With the Leann Follain I have a mixed approach, this beer starts of very promising. It has alll the malt, the light hints of chocolate and roast notes. It however does also have an aftertaste of almost liquorice notes and a bitterness I am not used to. Perhaps this can grow on you somewhat, for me this is not my cup of coffee/stout.

Aroma: burnt malt, coffee.
Appearance: black with small brown head.
Taste: burnt malt, chocolate, coffee, dry in finish. Middle bitterness.
Palate: middle carbonation, full body.
0,5l bottle. Extremely enjoyable, what a great unexpected find. Overall a superb stout.
Very nice beer! Good head retention. Aroma of chocolate/smoke/spiciness. Delicious.

33cl bottle from Maksimarket, Tartu. Very dark brown with a modest, but lasting beige head. Aroma of roasted malt with dark chocolate, dark fruits, hints of coffee and caramel. Medium sweet with medium flavour intensity and a modest bitterness. Rather tasty stout.

Pours black with a dark brown head. It has aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, and roast. There are flavors of roast, coffee, and a low dark chocolate element. The finish is dry with moderate bitterness that is long lasting. It has a medium body with some creaminess and a very slight astringent element. Overall, this is a fairly malt forward stout.

Bottle in Ireland. Black colour, with a small light brown head that disappears fast. Nose is light roasted malts, definite coffee. Taste is low roasted malty bitterness. Finish of chocolate powder and coffee. Low carbonation, but wouldnt wish for more, as it makes the mouth feel very smooth. Nice.
330ml bottle. Thick black colour with a thick tan head. Aroma is smoke, chocolate, coffee. Taste is sweet, chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Excellent

330ml bottle from beer52. Pours pours black with a off white head that fades to cap but stays. Lovely nose, coffee, roast nuts, roast malt, wholemeal toast. Taste is coffee, roast malts and a touch of vanilla. Really silky mouthfeel and low carbonation with a good, balancing bitter bite at the end. Lovely stout.

The beer looks like a true Irish stout. The color of the beer is a lovely black jn the naked eye. With a strong light behind the beer, a nice ruby red glow is unveiled. The beer seems rather clears. On top of the beer, a minimal layer of almond conjured foam is formed. The bulk of the foam collapses, to leave a minimal creamy drape. 
The smell is lovely. Its really a stout smell. It has mainly the sweet aromas of a stout. I smell sweet chocolate, mocha, coffee and some vanilla. I also smell some cherries and alcohol. All in all, a nice smell. I mis the roasted barley a little. This is present, but I wished it was a lot stronger. The smell had a little more of this. I taste done lovely bitter roast flavors. I love those flavors. I also taste some caramel, chocolate, mocha, vanilla and some licorice. There is also a little touch of cherry. The roast flavor had something salty. The beer has a nice bouquet of flavors and aromas. Its very nice. The palate is nice. The beer has done nice tingly bubbles. This is lovely in combination with the stouty flavors and aromas. A lovely brew. Ive been waiting to drink this for a kin get time. Im glad Ive waited till the right moment.

Irish Stout doux et aromatique légèrement astringent qui offre des senteurs classiques au nez: café moulu, malts très torréfiés caramélisés aigrelets. Dès lattaque je reçois une bouche pleine: les saveurs dabord de café caramélisé, puis de chocolat biscuité en arrière bouche, enrobent bien les papilles avec beaucoup de longueur. Sensation poudreuse et argileuse sur la langue. Le blé grillé donne au surplus une petite aigreur bienvenue dans toute cette douceur qui se termine avec une gentille âcreté. Souple et moelleuse.
Pours black with medium off-white head. Aroma is trees, forest, oak, dark roast coffee, some fruits, dried vegetables. Taste is woody, oak, cocoa, dark chocolate, burned organic stuff. Nice, light!

Bottle at Sternbräu, Rankweil. Aroma is dark malt, milk chocolate, mocha, cocoa powder, some roast, touch of vanilla. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Body is medium, a bit creamy. Great drinkability, easy and smooth with plenty of chocolate in aroma and flavour.
helt svart med fin beige topp. Lukter kaffe, toffe tørt gress og et hint av aske. Ferske kaffebønner, sjokolade i smaken sammen med et lett metallisk preg. Behagelig, bitter avslutning.

330ml bottle. Very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, mocha, roasted malt, light smoke, toffee. Bittersweet flavours of dark chocolate and coffee, roasted malt, smoke, toffee. Dry bittersweet finish. Smooth creamy mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Bottle at Appellation Wines tasting. Dark brown body with a thin beige head. Aroma of wood, dark chocolate and rye bread. Flavour of burnt wood and Coco Pops. Thin to medium body with a creamy mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Smooth and roasted.
Bottle at appellation. Pours deep brown, nose is roasted, chocolate, light smoke, toffee, taste is similar, quite dry.

Look: dark brown, almost black, opaque, with cappuchino head.

Aroma is very intense: sweet coffee, cocoa.
Taste: moderate sweetness with subtle bitternees.
Flavour: roasted, coffee with milk and chocolate topping, some deser alcohol notes (rum, coffee liqeure).

Very good.
Bottle at Comely Bankers III. Dark brown. Nose is coffee, chocolate, dark malts. Taste is a bit thing and light, dryish roast, liqorice.
From bottle. Pours opaque black, fawn head. Aromas of dark chocolate, spicy, coffee grind, toffee. Full bodied, bitter, Smokey taste.

Bottle thanks to McNeillR. 
Appearance - opaque black with a nice fawn head.
Nose - dark chocolate and coffee. Some prunes. 
Taste - creamy chocolate. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - good beer.
Bottle at Comely Bankers III. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas of liquorice, tar. Taste is chocolate, liquorice. Sweet finish.

My experience with OHaras more commonly known Irish Dry Stout was good enough to make me want to try another. Im sure glad I did. Leann Follain has touches of cream and soy sauce in the aroma under the usual notes of blackened barley. Flavor has beautiful rich chocolate notes that are balanced by a coffee-like bitterness thats bright and roasty. Bone dry mouthfeel. This feels bigger than 6% - bold, viscous, and full-bodied. Heres to hoping I can get my hands on some of the barrel-aged versions some point in the future.

33cl bottle from Beer52.com. A cola coloured pour with a bright cherry red glint and a ring of tan head; aroma of chocolate and well roasted malts; rich and sharply bitter in the mouth, with burnt toast and coffee ground flavours; and then a dry finish with lingering bitterness and a satisfying warmth. A rather good stout.

Bottle from jonski. Lovely looking black pour, creamy tan head. Big chocolate and nuts, vanilla nose. Medium body, light fiZz. Liquorice, coffee, chocolate, ash. Light spice, dark fruit. Sweet and bitter finish. Really good.
Black color with a tall head. Strong espresso and cocoa aroma. Sharp, bitter chocolate taste. Barley and coffee notes. Light fruity esters towards finish. Dry, slightly bitter. Really nice.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Trysil. Pours pitch black with a thick beige head that settles to a veil above the beer throughout the session. The aroma is awesome - a mix of roasted malts and cacao. The taste comes in waves, roasted malts and chocolate, backed by a powerful bitterness. The carbonation is very lively and it lifts the beer even further. Nice to see an irish brewer challenging the big guy like this!

Pours pitch black with a thin creamy head. Very complex and rich aroma best described as a good coffee liquor: dark chocolate, hints of alcohol and lots of sweet coffee. Very thick body with a silky texture. Complex taste comprised of dark chocolate, coffee, dark caramel, even some rum notes. Suprizingly amazing beer, especially for its price.

Poured from bottle into a pint glass
 Appearance  The beer pours a nearly pitch black color with a one finger head of brown colored foam. The head has a great level of retention, slowly fading over time to leave a ton of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell  The aroma of the brew is big of a roasted malt smell mixed with hints of vanilla and a moderate coffee smell. Along with these aromas comes notes of a bit of a burnt aroma as well as some dark chocolate smells.
 Taste  The taste begins with a nice drier roasted taste mixed with a decent showing of coffee. Quickly after the initial taste there is a light chocolate sweetness that comes to the tongue along with a tiny bit of vanilla. The chocolate loses sweetness as the taste moves on taking on a slightly more bitter taste. This is joined by some burnt flavors and char more toward the end, leaving one with a rather dark and toasty taste to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel  The body of the brew is slightly thicker to average for a stout of 6 % abv. with a carbonation level that is on the slightly higher side. A little bit less carbonation would have been better for the nice roasty tastes of the brew, but with the decently thick body, the feel was still nice overall.
 Overall  I rather enjoyed this dry Irish stout. Roasty and toasty with some nice burnt flavors and aromas. Overall a pretty good stout.
Bottle at work. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of coffee, cocoa, some caramel and hops. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, coffee, caramel, roasted malt.

500 ml bottle, from Vinmonopolet Madla. ABV is 6.0%. Black colour, moderate tan head. Moderate aroma of roast malts and coffee, hints of chocolate, a whiff of vomit. Medium dry flavour, roast malts and coffee again, also dark bitter chocolate, tar and unsweetened liquorice.

the aroma is caramel and chocolate with hints of toast, robust, vanilla and toffee... the taste is caramel and chocolate with notes of roasted malt, toffee, coffee and some spices... sweet and dry aftertaste... nice stout...

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 28.02.17. Brazowe piwo, bardzo ladna piana. aromaty intensywnej czekolady, kawy, slodkie nuty (chyba troche wanilii troche slodkich jakichs owocowych klimatow, troche melasy...), palonosc... w ustach to co bylo w aromacie jest powtorzone, ale w intensywniejszy sposob. rowniez bardziej do przodu wychodza te nutki waniliowe (slodkie, momentami mysli sie, ze to milk stout), palone, pojawia sie popiolowosc. nisko+ wysycony, ciala nie za wiele ale dzieki intensywnosci w ustach zadnych pomyslow na okreslenie "wodnisty" czy insze takie. Za to jest dosc lekki a zarazem majacy kremowa fakture., bardzo szybko znikajacy z pokala, lekka, ciut przyprawowa goryczka. bardzo ladnie zharmonizowane wszystko w nim jest. Generalnie - jestem pod duzym wrazeniem - a wszystko to wszak z tak niewysokiego ekstraktu... klasa.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
.3l on tap @Harrys. Pours black with low brown head. Aroma is burned malts, some hops, chocolate, coffee and syrup. Flavor is mostly same with medium body.

Bottle. Black beer with little head. The aroma is lightly roasted, and the flavour is smoothly coffee and lightly roasted with some bitterness. Overall a reasonable gently flavoured stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une légère mousse beige, une couleur noire, arôme de malts torréfiés, de moka. Au goût le café est bien présent, cest très sec. Une stout irlandaise dont je ne suis pas fan. 50Cl Comptoir Irlandais Paris
Pours a black colour. Tadye is of roast malts and quite dry. Very similar to Guinness foreign stout but a bit better

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, brązowa, dość obfita. 
Aromat kawowy, wytrawny. 
W smaku słodkawe, z kwaskowym posmakiem. 
Bardzo przyjemne, nie jest do końca delikatne, ale lekko aksamitne. Jakby z dodatkiem owsa. 
Trochę jakby było z laktozą ale nie ma jej w składzie. 
Niskie wysycenie, bardzo pijalne. 
Ogólnie doskonały stout.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours almost pitch black with a big creamy beige head. Dark malty aroma with some distinct liquorice note, some roast and coffee as well. Weak creamy mouthfeel. Taste is light sweet liquorice, some weak roasted malts and coffee, rather enjoyable overall.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Black pour with a light tan head. Aromas of chocolate, raisin, toffee, burnt spice, toffee and vanilla. Flavours of dark chocolate, licorice, coffee and ash. Sweet, malty mouthfeel. nice.
Off white, brownish head. Nice not overpowering coffee flavour, chocolate sweetness. A touch of spiciness. Very nice solid effort.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown, looking black in the glass. A medium, creamy tan head. Moderate roast and milk chocolate on the nose. Vanilla as well. Taste is light sweet but balanced. Moderate roasty notes, chocolate and a light bitter finish. A nice stout. Medium to full bodied with avg to soft co2 levels.

Bottle. Its a dark brown beer topped by a dense, finger-thick beige head. Some licorice in the aroma after a while, with roasted malts, oatmeal and chocolate showing up first and doing most of the work. Its full-bodied, lightly sweet, yet feeling dry on the palate. A decent bitterness blends in with the roasted malts, licorice and coffee in the mouth, lasting for a good while. Sure a fine stout, easy drinkable too. 151215

Bottle kindly donated by kazator, many thanks. Almost black colored with huge beige head, Roasted malt, cocoa, coffee in aroma. Strong roasted malt, coffee, cocoa in taste. Long coffee bitter finish. Very good.

Tap. Pours black with a small off-white head. No aroma to speak of. Taste is of roasted malts, hops, a bit of dark fruits and a bit of chocolate. Toasty and bitter finish. By no means bad but just plain boring and generic. The only real positive thing is the bitterness which elevates it to slightly more drinkable than a Guinness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330 ml from Amstein - St-Légier (CH). Black beer with an average tan head. Roasted aromas of black chocolate, moccha, hint of vanilla. The taste is burnt, very perfumed of chocolate-moccha, a bit black fruits, touch of vanilla and spiced impression. Bitterness of roast braided by hops. An in every respect remarkable Stout.
How: Bottle Appearance: almost black, medium light brown head. Aroma: dark chocolate, caramel, brown sugar, vanilla and some cardemom. Palate: medium body, soft carbonation.

Brown/black color. Average carbonation. Enticing roasted aromas. Some vanilla with a touch of fruitiness. Dry and quite bitter, almost too much. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Flavors of vanilla, chocolate, burned malts. Herbal hoppy finish. Delicious.

0,5 l bottle. A little weak aroma, but its roasted barley, chockolate, coffe and vanilla. The taste is dominated by the same. Nice body and perfect bitterness. A nice stout. In Norway this is one of the cheapest 0,5 l bottles at Vinmonopolet (NOK 47) and its absolute worth it!

330 ml bottle. dark brown - black color with strong creamy caramel head. taste are fine roast malt with barley sweetness and dark chocolate with coffee notes. all tastes are fine balanced. long aftertaste with nice dark chocolate and cacao notes and sweet roast barley sweetness. fine stout.

Bottle 0.5L.
Dark brown body with an average, creamy, tan head, mostly lasting with good lacing.
Moderate malty (toasted, light caramel) aroma with notes of chocolate, coffee and licorice.
Moderate sweet flavour with light-to-moderate bitterness that becomes more intense in the finish with a roasted character.
Medium-to-full body with oily texture; soft carbonation.

Chocolate, vanilla, licorice, coffee, roasty, very appealing. Black colour, tan head. Medium bite, salty, mid-bitter, lots of roastiness. 
Medium body, average carbonation, roasty finish. 
Solid.

50 cl bottle. Pours a really dark brown to blackish beer in the glass, thin beige to light brown head. Aroma is that familiar toffee, caramel, coffee roasted barley kind of aromas, as one would expect from a stout. Flavours are rich and complex. Lively carbonation up front, toasty toffee in the middle, and dry coffee bitterness in the aftertaste, lasting for a long time. Vanilla? Label says so, I cant pick up any of that.

Bottle. Pours a deep brown, near-black body with a large creamy light beige head. Nose is brown bread, chocolate, coffee, sawdust and hints of caramel, biscuits and nougat. Taste is chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel and hints of brown bread, nuts and biscuits. Medium body with a dry, chalky finish and a medium carbonation level. Pretty decent stout; kinda like a big brother to the classic dry stout. Likable.

Black body with a small, creamy, brown and long-lived head, good lacing. Dry and moderate aroma of roasted malt and faint fruits, with chocolate and ash in the back. Moderate flavour of coffee and ash, fruits and chocolate in the back. Light sweet taste with a rather long-lasting moderate bitter finish. Light to mid-bodied, with a creamy and smooth texture. It has a moderate carbonation and it dries up in the aftertaste. A nice one. 
[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 1 year before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Small beige head. Opaque black body. Mealy perfumy chocolatey aroma
with milky earthy notes. Dryish roasty earthy perfumy taste with
mealy fruity notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft, mealy mouthfeel. Dryish
roasty chocolatey aftertaste with perfumy fruity burnt notes. Long,
lingering burnt, mealy finish is quite nice. (0.5l bottle, from wine
monopoly, Strømmen.)

Pours very dark brown almost black with excellent huge light brown head. Very strength aroma of chocolate, coffee beans. Very intense taste, medium bitter, light sweet, very long lasting chocolate aftertaste with alcoholic notes/ Full body, thick feel, soft carbonation,

Impenetrably black, with thick brown foam.
The aroma of thick, rich chocolate and want to eat it

A really Irish dry stout, from a 50 cl bottle. My first beer from this well-known and very Irish brewery. Opaque black colour under a creamy, lacing, yellow beige, fairly stable head. Very pleasant and attractively perfumed aroma of cocoa, milk chocolate, cappuccino, leather, bayleaf, raisins, walnuts, mocha ice cream and even some sweet honey, candied figs, black coffee grounds, pipe tobacco, some faint cloves, coconut, vanilla and liquorice perhaps and a vague hint of balsamic vinegar for balance; no off-flavours whatsoever, even the dreaded iron effect is nowhere to be seen.  Dense taste with some candied sweetness but subduedly so, rather sparkling carbo (perhaps a bit much for this style), subtle sourish touch, supple and smooth mouthfeel but less creamy than expected from the style, a bit minerally, with a big, full dark maltiness in the middle, chocolatey, caramelly and nutty without any of these components dominating; finishes in a slightly ashy, coffee-like roasted bitterness, mouth-filling and lining the root of the tongue and the throat, very rounded and soft, with a leafy, somewhat spicy hop bitterness adding complexity; retronasal spiciness not unlike cloves and vanilla. In all: a very decent, robust and well-crafted dry stout, with a very inviting aroma; if Id have to find something to pick on, it would be the carbonation, which is a little bit too high for the style and distracts a bit from the creamy maltiness. Nevertheless, I enjoyed this very much, highly recommendable for maltheads.  In terms of style: indeed maybe a bit sweet for a dry stout, so I can go along with the classification as a plain stout without further specification.

A: Pours an ultra-dark brown color. Not perfectly opaque, mind you, but nearly. The head is a two finger heavy cream color with nice texturing, before it settles to one finger. Nice retention, too.

S: There are a ton of roasted malts and coffee. Some chocolate pops up, as well, perhaps even a hint of smoke. It also smells hoppy, even - maybe it IS generously hopped? I mean, that character of grapefruit peel prominent in Cascade hops is unmistakable here.

T: Again, theres a healthy flavor of grapefruity hops right there in the midtaste. It starts a bit chocolaty before the hops come in full (well, moderate) force. Finish is pure roasted barley. Generally, its mild in flavor; while this keeps the competing flavors in check, it makes it a bit dull. Luckily its not overly acidic as many well-hopped stouts/porters tend to be.

M: Hits the clean dryness typical of the style well, but the finish goes too far into being astringent. A bit insubstantial and undercarbonated in its feel; par for the course in many dry stouts. Great drinkability nonetheless.

O: And as I finish my glass, I notice the bottle cap somehow fell down in there. How the hell did that happen?! Oh well, this a fine offering. Not great, but fine.

The aroma was of chocolate, caramel and burned charriness along with shoe polish and freshness. Flavors of burnt toffee, dark chocolate and rum cake. Just more-ish and sippable. A trace of spiciness is there along with a big helping of licorice, but the palate is taking in the classic Irish stout flavours and aromas. What a treat. What a wonderful treat.

500ml bottle. Aroma is coffee and dark chocolate. Light dark fruits as well. Appearance is deep black with a nice brownish foam. Taste is light sour and sweet, malty. Has a full body and a soft carbonation. Overall a superb stout.

Bottle. Dark brown, almost black colour with creamy light brown head. Strong aroma of dark chocolate, caramel, brown sugar, roasted malts. Oily, full bodied with lively carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden.

Bottled 500ml. -from Bières Cultes at Rue des Halles, Paris. Almost black coloured, medium sized brown head, mild and pleasant chocolate coffee nose. Roasted malt, Chocolate and dry coffee with bitter sweet finish. A bit "empty taste" after LH Fade to Black Pepper but also pleasant brew.

Bottle at Reubens, thanks!
Pours dark ruby tinged brown with foamy tan head. Aromatic pipe tobacco, chocolate and a touch of lactose on the nose. Full bodied with fairly vigorous carbonaton, dry roast barley up front with a touch of malt astringency finishing with malt chocolate and caramel.

Bottle, bought @ Bierzwerg. Deep brown to black with a lovely, staying, creamy beige head. Aroma has roasted malts, chocolate, nuts. Mild berries. Mild carbonation, fine creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is mild, liquorice, roasted malts. Fairly short finish.

Bottle 50cl.A dark beer with brown medium head. Nose is roasted and coffee like. Aroma is on creamy dark chocolate, caramel, roasted malt with dark malt notes, light licorice, light peppery hops, very roasted aftertaste. Very smooth and pleasant stout.
UPDATED: APR 17, 2013 500ml bottle. Dark chocolate aromas. Pours dark with tan head, some lacing. Medium body and flat carbonation. Taste is roast malt, coffee, chocolate, some spicy. Sweet finish.

Átláthatatlan fekete főzet rubinvörös tónusokkal, melynek kitöltésekor egy  a pohár szélét kicsipkéző  krémes és tartós bézs habtakaró képződik.
Illata pörkölt magvas.
Aromájának karamell és vaníliát idéző, malátás alapját kávés, csokoládés, némi aszalt gyümölcsös és földes ízek kísérik.
A szirupos testességű ser finise keserédes és közepesen száraz, fanyar csersavas, étcsokoládés, fűszeres és finoman alkoholos aláfestéssel.
Ízletes, könnyedén csúszó stout.

(bottle) Black coloured hue with a brown and thick foamy head. Leathery and moderately roasted malty aroma with chocolate and hints of mocha. Moderately roasted bitter and slightly burnt flavour, medium to light bodied with a smooth carbonation. Slightly burnt and melanoidic malty taste with an ashy and discreetly smoky touch; roasty bitter and delicately sweet finish with a tinge of hops detectable. Not a great but nice one. 16.III.12
Pours jet black with a good beige lasting head, nose of toast and coffee, taste is roasty and coffee.  Overall a very tasty stout

Black colour with a creamy beige head. Mild sweet aroma with coffee and some roasted notes. Moderate sweet flavour. Mild coffee and roasted malt. Unusual fresh. Very enjoyable stout.[Bottle from Dublin airport, Ireland]

50 cl bottle @ OHaras, Tampere.
Rated on 20110611.
Pours pitch black color with light velvety head. Aroma of mild metallic chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. Flavor of dry ashy chocolate, mild coffee and malts. Silky smooth palate, well balanced brew.
6325

February 15, 2011. Shared by garthicus with blankboy and me. 500ml bottle.  Opaque ruby-black with a nice lasting creamy light brown head.  Smells of mocha with light lactic sourness and a whisper of background peat. Taste is similar, add in some chocolate and burnt hardwood - not as sweet as the aroma - background creaminess, light alcohol.  Thick, creamy mouthfeel, mild carbonation (appropriate) - a nice frothy hot chocolate character up front with some sharp dry herbal bitterness in the tail.  Very nice.  Rich.

Bottle 0,5L. BeerBier, Budapest. Stout with its creamy beige head. Smells like coffee and chocolate, tastes likes fizzy fruity drink. Redfruits what I mean. It could be thicker, but a very intensive stout. Good one.

0.5L bottle from beer bier, Budapest.  I am excited by the thought of an Irish craft beer company. This "leann follain" stut pours really nice. Deep black in colour with a lovely thick brown frothy head. Aroma is rustic, roasted coffee, laced with what seem dark chocolate. The aroma is warm, smokey, urnt and goes deep. medium to full body. Taste is first roasted coffee,malts with a slight burnt bitterness. medium carbonation clean finsih with slight longing bitterness. Nice stout. can compete with guinness FX and kills the guinness draught dead.

Bottled at Kuikka 0.5L. Soft chocolatey nose. Dark brownish black colour. Pale brownish creamy color. Soft fullfilled malty slightly sourish taste. Hints of chocolate. Average hoppiness. Good soft stout.

Bottle. Very dark brown  almost black, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, roasted malt and light chocolate, faint licorice and hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, roasted malt and some chocolate with light licorice. Finish is average, malty and dryish, roasted malt, light chocolate/coffee, faint licorice and hoppyness. Dryish stout with roasted malt - not too much chocolate/coffee.
500ml bottle. Opaque black with creamy stable off-white to beige head. Roasty dark malt aroma, Salty, roasty taste with a late slightly sweet coffee note. Good.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2012 Ebony silky pour with a tan cap and lacing. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, peat and faint hint of vanilla. Initially sweet turning to bitter. Full bodied with good carbonation. Sweet from the malt, chocolate and vanilla, bitter from the coffee. Simples! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle sample at a blind porter/stout tasting. Pours black opque. Sweet carob, raisin aroma, bitter, roast, wood and somewhat rough taste. Medium carbonation, medium body.

Its been some years since Ive had this beer and it had improved dramatically during that time. Sweet chocolate aroma. Woody flavour, sweet, chocolate, vanilla. Gentle carbonation and soft palate. Pretty tasty.

Bottle in a hotel room in Dublin.
Black coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Roasted aroma of liquorice, hay and caramel.
Roasted flavour of hay, liquorice and hops with notes of peat.
Roasted finish.

Pours oil black with a large mocha-colored head. Aroma of cherries and coffee, with some breadiness, very pleasant. Taste dry and quite bitter, full bodies and roasty, developing into a dry but not overly bitter palate. All in all, very good Irish stout
Pours pitch black with a lasting medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts and chocolate. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee and chocolate. Very nice.

(Bottle at Kuikka, 20111104) The beer poured black. Its head was quite large and light brown. Aroma had liquorice and roasted malts. Palate was full bodied and dryish with medium carbonation. Flavours were roasted malts, bitter dark chocolate, ash, hops and bitterness. Aftertaste was ashy and bitter. A promising aroma and quite harsh taste.

Bottle 500ml.Clear dark brown colour with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light brown head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, chocolate, light meat - toffee. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration, dark roasted. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20111001]
Bottle @ Autumn Tasting, Ulfborg 2011. Pours black with a creamy beige head and lacings. Chocolate, fruit and roast. Smooth and medium bodied. Slick. Really tasty.
Almost black with a small dark brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 011011
Bottle. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, medium sweet, coffee, hops and a little bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel and hops.

50 cl bottle @ OHaras Freehouse, BBE 28.03.2012
Aroma has sweetish, roasted malt and goldings-like hops. Flavour has coffee, caramel and roasted malt. Some chocolate at finish. Good and balanced stout, although the goldings-like flavour disturbs me a bit here.
Bottle. Dark. A nice dark chocolately stout. Slight coffee notes. Really pretty good.
Bottle. Aroma of chocolate malt. Flavour is roasted toffeee with a strong chocolte background. Finish is bitter roast malt

A deep dark stout with a thin brown head. In aroma, a smooth chocolate with smooth vinous notes, molasses, dark fruits, almost veering on imperial stout territory. In mouth, a earthy and woody chocolate malt with some nice vinous and woody notes, delicate, peaty and very nice. Bottle from MLCB, via trade with Piscator, about 1.5 years ago. And it is still delish! Thanks Kris.

Opaque dark brown color, thick brown head. Coffeish, a bit milky aroma, slightly acidic too. Medium-bodied. Coffee, milky notes, ashy toasted malts and kind of acidic notes. Not very balanced, coffee brings too much acidity this otherwise toasted malty stout.

50cl bottle @ Bull and Castle, Dublin. Thanks Dave.
Brune foncée, mousse moka.
Arôme à une énorme dose de malt grillé et caramel avec ce que je pense être un côté lactique aigre mélangé avec du butterscotch.

Very dark brown.  Big puffy head.  Richly roasty.  Light chocolate.  Full, rich, but with buttery notes.  Too much diacetyl really messes this one up - not what I want in a stout.

black extra stout, coffee, some chocolate, hints of vanilla, hop bitterness in the finish. absolutely delicious complex flavors, some american brewers can take a lesson from this one due to the complex flavors that dont require a double digit abv. extremely enjoyable, what a great unexpected find.

Bottle [500ml] shared with HogTownHarry & garthicus -- c/o garthicus. Pours black with ruby highlights and an average size diminishing creamy tan head. Aroma of coffee along with some chocolate, herbs, molasses and oddly, a hint of jalapeno. Flavour of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Average bodied. Pretty good.

Bottle @ Bull & Castle. Black and beautiful with yummy head. Dark malt dough and dark sugar, raisin and caramel. Soft and easy mouthfeel. Dry and smoky. Not roasty, not sweet. Banana-coffee nuances and a pleasant touch of acidity in the dry finish.

Bottled at L. Mulligan Grocer, Dublin.  Ver yblack, rich head. Chocolate mud cake from nose to finish. Mid sweet with dense well rounded and well sized body. Plenty of licorice, notes of coffee and leather couch. Mildly warming finish with salty bitterness. A top stout with soft edges.

Bottle @ The Bull & Castle. Appearance: Pitch black, oily, small brown/yellow head. Aroma: lots of iron & rust up front, tons of dark fruit, raisins, plums, blueberries, quite a tart aroma with a dash of smoke in there too. Lovely. Flavour: Super bitter, lots of raisins, tangy copper, very decent alcoholic bite with a great smoke finish. Delicious. A real shining star amongst the Irish craft brew scene

wow, what an aroma! coffee and chocolate- easily in the top ten of any beer i have ever had! the nose is wonderful .. . tastes of coffee, chocolate, light tar, minerals, and earth..lots of minerals actually, very unique! - very tasty, this is great stuff! .. .  delicious and quite unique, nothing really like it  .. carlows best and an exciting beer that would love to have again, thanks ma! .. . .

At a tasting, thanks Yuval, pours deep brown to black with a chocolate color head, aroma of raisins, cherries, liqurice, wood and cheesy notes, flavor is sour with some nice roasty notes, medium to light body, probably oxidized.

At a tasting, thanks Yuval, very little head, very dark brown colour, strong aromas of hay, barnyard, dark dried fruits and dark sour bread, flavour is very sour and unripe, some blue cheese, smokiness and chrred wood, very long and strong sour aftertaste with a nutty charred sensation. Strange but intriguing.
Bottle at a tasting: great aroma, wierd taste, cherry liquer, carob, smoked/moldy cheese, wet wood, some acidity, kind of rough, some rotten flavor, maybe infected?

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2014 Re-rate 2/12: Bottle sample at a Stouts & Porters blind tasting at Sar HaMashkaot Ramat Gan. Black with a beige to light brown head. Aroma of chocolate and "green" notes. Sweetish roasty flavor, chocolaty. Medium-bodied. 6/4/7/4/13=3.4

Re-rate 7/29/11: Bottle. Black-colored with a lovely light brown head. Nice roasted malt aroma with coffee, some chocolate and light fruitiness. Sweetish roasty flavor with coffee and a drier finish with light acidity. Medium-bodied. A good Stout. Glad I tried it again. 7/4/7/3/14=3.5

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks to Yuvals friend whose name I cannot remember at the moment. Black with a beige head. Aroma of thick chocolate and some dark fruit notes. Sweet-sour-bitter roasted flavor with malt, weird fruitiness, carob, coffee and yeast. Light-medium body. Aroma promises, flavor disappoints. A strange Stout. 7/3/5/3/10=2.8

Pours very dark brown with brown foam. Very carbonated - the main taste is of sharp bubbles! Drier than Guinness. Taste is closer to Guinness Extra, but its not too bitter, quite drinkable. Lies somewhere between the two.

very dark black, the brown head dissapears suddenly. aroma of mollases, licorice. taste starts mellow, sweet ends with a dryish burned malt finish, but the dryness is not excessive. cigar smokiness also, an ok stout but I prefer their original one.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2013 Bottle from Utobeer shared with MagicDave.  Liquorice stout with a bit of cardboard.  Tar on aroma, really bad finish.  Like a dead rodent.  Poor. 1.8 Re-rate I bought this by mistake at Terre de Boissons, Calais.  Its a lot better than the first time.  Still a little liquorice, but better flavours.  Must have been a bad bottle last time.  I even quite like it.  Good choc and coffee and pleasant in mouth, some very mild sour acidity on finish.  OK.
Bottle thanks to Ian, had in the rake. Roasty, tart, massivly carbonated, cereal malt character comes through. Really poor.

Bottle at home ... no idea where i got this ... but it cost me £2:30 ... deep black ... thin tan head ... sweet meaty big malt nose ... this alone puts it above its average so far ... bit overy fizzy ... nice meaty roast malt ... but thin ... oddly this remonds me a little of the Kaggen in its flavour ... but its thinness lets it down badly ...theres also a tiny tinge of sourness...  This is probably the beer that holds the most promice of what it could have been. It probably needs taken up a point or two and some more boddy added and this could go from 3.4 ->4.4 with one little step

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2009 Bottle bought in Dublin. Black with small tan head. Slightly spicy and fruity flavor with a roasted aftertaste. A bit bitter. Claimed chocolate and coffee flavors but these were hard to notice.  Slightly stronger than most stouts available in Ireland but its strength was not noticeable. Tastes okay overall and wasnt much to look at.

Source:12 oz bottle purchased in Dublin. 
Glass:Pint. 
Appearance:Dark black pour with a thin brown head.  
Aroma:Faint aroma of roasted malt, dark fruits and soy sauce. 
Flavor:HEAVY soy sauce.  Detracted from the rest. 
Palate:Medium/full body with soft carbonation.
Overall:Soy detracted enough that I would like to try another bottle.

[2183-20090520] 355mL bottle. Sweet malt, molasses and taffy aroma. Black body with a medium-lasting creamy light tan head. Sweet molasses flavour has a weird leafy forest peat note and a mild wet banana bread with walnuts. Full body. Interesting to try, weird sweet peat aftertaste.
(@ Abbots Ale House; Cork, Ireland; w/ jerc)

Bottled sample. Pours almost black in colour with modarate carbonation. Aromas of stewed sour red berries, plums, molasses, booze, and milk chocolate. Roasty notes come through a bit more in the mouth, with elements of mild roast coffee, chocolate, hazelnut, vanilla, and more plum. Slick mouthfeel and medium bodied. It seems way too fruity and not roasty enough for a stout. Like jerc mentioned, the sourish tang is quite strong (in an unbalanced way for me).

Bottle, 355 ml. Pours very dark bodied, with none to little head. Very rich aroma of bitter chocolate and treacle. Much the same on the palate, wtih pleasant blend and balance of sweet and sour. A decent ale overall.

2009-05-20. Black body with a modest brown head. Roasty aroma has a bit of a tang to it. Flavour is bitter and roasty, again a bit of a sour tang to it, possibly off or stylistically on purpose, very light chocolate undertones. Smooth average plus body. Bottle at Abbot Ale House, Cork

A - toasted maulty nose

P - smooth finish
O - I enjoyed this, but not as much as others of this type. It lacks the character and boldness many of the others.
